overview_summary: None of these four neighbors has a clearly documented public stance on new development projects. Their community influence varies widely: one (the Brophy family) is a historically significant ranching family with high influence, another is a local developer with moderate influence, and the remaining two appear to have low public profiles.

neighbors.name: Kovan Mountjoy
neighbors.claims: Kovan Mountjoy is listed as a contact for ABM Development LLC, a locally owned real estate development firm based in Huachuca City ([www.abmdevelopment.com](https://www.abmdevelopment.com/contact-us#:~:text=Kovan%20Mountjoy)). ABM Development has operated in the area for over 20 years as a family-run home builder and land development business ([www.abmdevelopment.com](https://www.abmdevelopment.com/#:~:text=)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a business-oriented approach through local builders or the chamber, highlighting how the project could align with community growth without harming real estate values.

neighbors.name: Michelle White
neighbors.claims: A "White, Michelle" appears in public records databases, but aside from the property ownership, no public profile or civic role for this person is evident ([truepeoplesearch.net](https://truepeoplesearch.net/people/michelle-white#:~:text=Also%20known%20as%3A)). No references to a Michelle White were found in local news, suggesting a private individual with no notable public involvement ([cochise.az.gov](https://cochise.az.gov/CivicAlerts.aspx?CID=1#:~:text=News%20Flash%20%E2%80%A2%20Cochise%20County%2C,Hard%20copies%20are%20also%20available)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach one-on-one through a neighborly introduction, listening to any personal concerns since she has not voiced opinions publicly.

neighbors.name: Frank Cullen Brophy
neighbors.claims: Frank Cullen Brophy acquired the historic 18,000-acre Babacomari Ranch in 1935, becoming its third owner since Spanish colonial times ([babacomariranch.com](https://babacomariranch.com/history#:~:text=In%201935%2C%20Frank%20Cullen%20Brophy,who%20served%20as%20frontiersmen%20and)). The Brophy family continues to hold the ranch through a family partnership, placing over 3,300 acres under conservation easements to protect its grasslands and wetlands ([babacomariranch.com](https://babacomariranch.com/history#:~:text=Brophy%20now%20numbering%20over%2060%2C,and%20Water%20Trust%2C%20the%20Nature)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Enlist a respected local conservation figure to initiate dialogue, emphasizing the project's land stewardship plans and respect for the ranch’s legacy and environment.

neighbors.name: Ricktor & Tawneen Meldrum
neighbors.claims: Ricktor and Tawneen Meldrum jointly own a parcel in Cochise County (PIN 106-54-003Y), but they are not mentioned in any local news reports or public records beyond that ownership ([thetombstonenews.com](https://thetombstonenews.com/index46.htm#:~:text=The%20Tombstone%20News%20,Rest%20in%20Peace%20and%20God)). No evidence was found of either having a public-facing role in the community or commenting on local issues ([thetombstonenews.com](https://thetombstonenews.com/index46.htm#:~:text=The%20Tombstone%20News%20,Rest%20in%20Peace%20and%20God)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach discreetly through a mutual acquaintance or community event, as they have no known stances—building rapport and learning their interests would guide effective engagement.
